arts.ttl: Ipswich savour first derby win in 16 years and Núñez rubs salt in Norwich wounds
arts.sum: Sixteen years of hurt have finally come to an end for Ipswich Town. A curse, that had lingered for longer than that on most abandoned burial grounds, was banished in conclusive fashion as East Anglian rivals Norwich City were defeated 3-1 and generally outclassed in the home side’s first win in 15 derbies. Goals from Cédric Kipré – the man of the match – the mercurial Jaden Philogene and Jack Clarke were the decisive moments of the match, Norwich’s kamikaze attacking another factor. But the figure of Marcelino Núñez, who scored against Ipswich for Norwich in the last derby match two seasons ago then completed a £10m move to Suffolk in the summer, loomed throughout. Featuring on the cover of the programme and in the voices of the Ipswich support, even as he started the match on the bench, this was a transfer troll that ultimately achieved the desired effect. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ipswich beat Norwich for first time in 16 years!
arts.sum: Ipswich Town won their first East Anglian derby for 16 years, beating their rivals Norwich City 3-1 at Portman Road.

arts.ttl: Ipswich Town vs Norwich City: EFL Championship Preview, Gameweek 9, 2025/26
arts.sum: Ipswich haven't beaten Norwich in sixteen years, but Sunday's meeting feels like as good a chance as any. Young left-back Lucien Mahovo made his long-awaited return from injury that night, too, but Manning hinted that the derby may come too soon for a first start in seven months.

arts.ttl: Ipswich vs Norwich predictions: Sargent can strike for Canaries
arts.sum: The latest edition of the East Anglian derby takes place on Sunday as Ipswich entertain local rivals Norwich, and Gareth Freeman thinks visiting striker Josh Sargent can get back among the goals at Portman Road.
